channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Numerous potholes at the beginning and end of the Seven Bends road from Aston Cross, 18th February
item.description:
Large and dangerous potholes by the entrance of building site and towards the other end of the Seven Bends round going past Pamington Farm.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): B4079, Oxenton, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bushes causing imminent damaged to property and obstructing visibility, 18th February
item.description:
Subject: Urgent Request for Site Inspection and Maintenance of Overgrown Vegetation Dear Sir or Madam, I am writing to formally report an issue regarding the excessively overgrown and unmaintained bushes and shrubs at the junction of Drews Court and Paynes Pitch. The overgrowth is obstructing visibility for traffic turning onto Paynes Pitch particularly entering or exiting property 34 Paynes Pitch, creating a significant safety hazard for both pedestrians and motorists. Additionally, these bushes are causing damage to adjacent properties. Specifically, the fence along the bushes at Property 34, Paynes Pitch has been damaged and pushed out of alignment, obstructing door access and preventing necessary repairs. Please find attached photographs illustrating the extent of the damage. I kindly request that the relevant authorities conduct an on-site inspection of the area and assess the damage caused. Prompt action to address and resolve this matter would be greatly appreciated. Thank you in advance for your time, assistance, and cooperation. Yours sincerely, Asim Mehmood

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Paynes Pitch, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large stretch of road crumbled away, just over the bridge on the 40 sign which is painted to the road, 18th February
item.description:
Over the railway bridge, heading towards Bamfurlong Lane, just after the 40 sign which is painted on the road is a large long section of tarmac, the width of vehicle tyres, that crumbled away since the bridge re opened. Can’t avoid driving over it as you’d be driving on the wrong side of the road to oncoming vehicles.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Badgeworth Road, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Entrance to Pirton Fields difficulties with access, 18th February
item.description:
B4063 Cheltenham Road East entrance to Pirton Fields (Goldsmith Road). It's extremely difficult getting in and out of the estate as there's only 1 narrow entrance/exit point. The speed of cars along the road is usually above the speed limit and at rush hour, it's a safety hazard at the junction due to a cycling crossing and zebra crossing all on a junction which is narrow and busy. The number of near misses has been significant amongst residents and traffic queues back up into the estate- some people sit for 20 mins before being able to get out. Yellow cross-hatchings would really benefit this junction, is this something that's feasible? For the speed of traffic along the road, a speed camera or flashing 30 sign between the fire station and junction would be helpful too. Even better, making it a traffic lit junction would be ideal, but aware this is costly. Please advise, thank you
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road East, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
